pageTitle: Gold Seeker Weekly Wrap-Up: Gold and Silver Fall About 4% on the Week
textBeforeTable: The Economy:   Gold and silver equities traded mostly slightly lower and ended with about 1.5% losses.   Euro gold fell to about 1224, platinum lost $20.25 to $1459.75, and copper fell 6 cents to about $3.63.   Gold fell $20.28 to $1573.72 by about 3:30AM EST before it climbed back to $1590.53 by late morning in New York, but it then fell back off into the close and ended with a loss of 0.8%.  Silver slipped to as low as $28.436 by midmorning in New York before it rallied back to $29.15, but it also fell back off in afternoon trade and ended with a loss of 0.58%.
textAfterTable: All of this weeks other economic reports:   Treasury Budget - April $59.1B v. -$40.4B   Export Prices - April
